intro: Melichrus erubescens, commonly known as the redstem sedges, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves and produces small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist environments, such as marshes and wetlands. Its reddish stems are a distinguishing feature, giving it its common name. Melichrus erubescens plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
